sentences.en: After struggling for months, it dawned on me that I needed to grovel.
sentences.cn: 在苦苦挣扎了几个月后, 我终于顿悟到自己应该在她面前卑躬屈膝才是.

sentences.en: Don't grovel — stick up for yourself!
He said he would never grovel before a conqueror.
sentences.cn: 他说他永远不会在征服者脚下摇尾乞怜.
我对谁都不会卑躬屈膝。

sentences.en: I saw him grovelling in the road for his hat.
sentences.cn: 我看到他趴在路上找帽子。

sentences.en: Manager : Ah! The famous Monsieur poirot. I grovel in mortification, I grovel !
sentences.cn: 乔德利: 啊,著名的波洛先生,我未免太失敬了, 失敬 了.

sentences.en: Maybe if I really grovel, he will pass me.
sentences.cn: 如果我真的去说说好话,也许他(老师)会让我及格.

sentences.en: Pessimistic persons would like to grovel on the floor rather than meet the challenge.
sentences.cn: 悲观的人宁肯永远趴在地上也不愿迎接挑战。

sentences.en: She will not grovel to anyone.
Since they speak straightforwardly and selflessly and never appear to grovel or fawn.
sentences.cn: 因为他们说话正直无私,容色也不阿谀谄媚.

sentences.en: Speakers have been shouted down, classes disrupted, teachers made to grovel.
sentences.cn: 发言人的声音被叫嚷声盖住了，课堂一片混乱，老师们不得不好言相劝。

sentences.en: Then he began to grovel and wail, " I deserve to die! "
sentences.cn: 这时他趴倒在地嚎叫道 “ 我该死 ”.

sentences.en: Were I such they would grovel at my feet.
sentences.cn: 倘若我真是暴君,他们就会俯伏在我的脚下了.

sentences.en: You will just have to grovel to the bank manager for a loan.
sentences.cn: 你只得低声下气地向银行经理借贷.

words.tran_cn: 奴颜婢膝的；卑下的；卑躬屈节的
（在卑屈、恐惧等时）匍匐；卑躬屈膝（grovel的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 趴, 匍匐, 卑躬屈膝, 五体投地的
trans.tran_en: to move along the ground on your hands and knees
